title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Beds", March 5, 1937
medium: Graphite, red color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower center (large portion of stamp missing): DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower center: 8568/F.S.D./ANDERSON, OLSSON/P.S./D./3.5.37, 3/18/37, 1, MASTERCR.; inscribed in graphite above stamp at right: ONE DOUBLE BED 6' - 7 3/4 X 4' X 10 1/4'/39" HEADBOARD - 24" FOOTBOARD/WITH TURNABLE LIGHT LIKE SHOWN//EAST INDIAN ROSEWOOD./VENEER ALL EXPOSED EDGES/DOMES OF SILENCE; below: TWO SINGLE BEDS 6' - 7 3/4" X 3' - 7 1/4" X 39" HEADBOARD/24" FOOTBOARD/WITH TURNABLE LIGHT - LIKE SHOWN/POLLARD OAK/VENEER ALL EXPOSED EDGES/DOMES OF SILENCE/VENEER INSIDE OF FOOTBOARD/SAME AS FRONT; dimensions, instructions, materials in graphite
description: Perspective, plan and elevation drawings for double bed and single beds for Anderson house. Double bed with turnable light; bed in east Indian rosewood. Two single beds with turnable light; beds in pollard oak.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Beds", March 5, 1937.
March 5, 1937. Graphite, red color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-961.
